description: If you have yet been to POUR it's a must do. Owner Chris is amazing, knowledgeable on tap selections. His staff was so welcoming, friendly, and also provided the best customer service. We we're lucky enough to try a off menu new burger creation. Lucky us. Don't deprive yourself of then pour experience.
author: Chris R.

description:
Pretty awesome place. Great bartender and knows when to cut people off. If you need a reprieve from Polk loud noises, this is it. 

Revise: I just looked at my receipt the next day that came in on my phone as they use Square. I'm annoyed. First off they didn't inform me I would have a credit card fee of 2.75% and California sales tax of 9.75%???  When did food and alcohol have different rates? It should have been 8.75%. 

I'm downgrading for these sneaky taxes.
author: Linda C.

description:
The Pour House is my new favorite place! They have a deal only on Tuesday's for a bottle of wine and a cheese platter for $25!!!!!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!! We got a nice 2015 petite sirah that was surprisingly very smooth. 

But the PLATTER!!! SO good for the price. You get HUGE blocks of cheese, 2 types of crackers, an assortment of nuts, pickles, and olives. We opted to add prosciutto to ours which was an extra $17 (yikes) but completely worth it.

Friends and I also stayed for a couple hours and were not pressured to leave ONCE. Also, it's in an interesting area as it's in the middle of Polk St but that's fine. I'll definitely be back!
author: Caroline K.

description: Decided on a glass of wine after dinner.  Picked this place.  Instead of "a" glass, we enjoyed a wine flight.  Service was great.  Ordered nuts and more wine.  Wonderful time.
author: Jonathan D.

description: Was looking for some drink before a show at the Grand Regency and found this little spot. Enjoyed a reasonably priced bottle of Syrah and in a relaxed, cozy atmosphere. Great service. Check it out!
author: Meghan E.

description: Wine selection personally wasn't for me, and at first the service was slow. I ordered the red wine flight and the Pinot Noir was the only one I liked. Then I ordered the Malbec, which normally I am a fan of, but this one I did not like. I felt bad, but I mentioned to the waitress I did not like my wine, and without hesitation she offered to switch it out. She gave me a taste of the Zinfandel which was a winner. This upgraded my review from a 3 to a 4 because she was so nice about switching out my wine. I did really like he ambiance here. It was cutely decorated but a little bright. I would stop by again for the Tuesday deal (bottle of wine and cheese platter for $25) but maybe not on a Friday night.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description:
Guys! This is the perfect casual wine bar whether you want to come after work for happy hour 3-7, Monday night for $3 dollar microbrews or have a verrrrry liberal amount of wine... this is your spot on Polk. Just moved around the corner and Sarah let us try a couple of different wines before choosing our glass. She was so sweet! 
This place POURS well compared to other joints. Definitely recommend it!
author: Megan P.

description: Stumbled across this bar while walking on Polk.  They have a lot of wine selections, but I ordered beer.  They have a little lounge area with comfy seats right when you walk in.  There's also some room in the back for small groups.  The bartender was cool and nice.  A little dark inside, but worth getting a drink and checking out.
author: KB B.

description: Nice quiet dive. Good selection, knowledgeable staff, good for conversations, a skip from the Polk party madness or after party madness. Standard cheese plate fare, excellent choice of wines, an excellent place to nest awhile
author: Juls C.

description:
My friends and I came too early to an event at the Regency ballroom so we came here to enjoy a glass a wine while passing the time.
The wine was great! I wish I remembered the name but it definitely got the tastebuds going.
The bartender was very friendly and informed us that he was a bit understaffed so we couldn't order food. However, he informed us that we could order thai food next door and they would deliver to us here at the wine bar! So basically that's what it did, and it was awesome! I never experienced food delivery at a wine bar but it was great! 
I love the deco around this place. There was such a cute table in the back filled with corks.
author: Heidi L.

description:
Nice spot for sips on a Saturday night! 4 friends and I stopped by at 10:45pm on a Saturday and it was probably less than half full. By 11:30pm the place was buzzing. 

We discovered the back area was completely empty so we took a seat back there. The area was perfect for a group our size. We got some glasses and flights, which were decent. I'd definitely go back again if I were in the area.
author: Emma W.

description: Love this place and Kevin was very kind! Great place and even has charging cords for your phone. Ambience is fab!
author: Love S.

description:
Really enjoyed this place! Stumbled in when playland had a cover. $5 blue moon & $11 red wine pour. It's super cute and the back area is all candle lit, with a couch you can sit on with a glass table and corks filled under it, barrel tables, and a pebble water fountain hanging from the wall! There's even a piano we played with for a bit! 

We walked in and were greeted with a red wine tasting. Such great bartenders! Thank you for a little solace on a rainy, dreary night.
author: Anmy V.

description: I have a unique perspective as I worked there for a day contemplating a midlife career change to bartend. From the very start, the owner was extremely personable and hospitable, gave me a chance to work. With that being said, this place takes operations seriously, everything from stock to making sure everything is crystal clean, rest assured your wine glass is spotless!! Not too many of these places are still around in SF today, old school personable owner, small business, good vibe. Mary Ellen is the woman that trained me and she is hella cool and easy to talk to. Really good place to bring a date, or just grab a casual drink with friends. I liked the place and working there (albeit, for a day) very much and would strongly recommend it to folks in the neighborhood. As for the job, I went back to a Union gig.
author: John A.

description: Four stars equals im impressed. Truly, a place to have a great beer or wine . Expect to visit soon !
author: Azu A.

description: Really nice relaxed ambience. Very sweet staff. Went here on a saturday evening and had no trouble finding seating. I was a little sad that they had soooo many types of wine but only 5-6 beers on draft (which included a PBR). That was disappointing. But all in all fun!
author: Ashmita V.

description:
The Pour House is cozy, sophisticated and friendly. There's a lot of leather and wine barrel decor - so you feel pretty fancy in this spot. The staff was attentive and welcoming. 

Tried the white flight (no jokes about moving to the suburbs, please!), and enjoyed it. Moved on to a glass of happy hour sparkling wine, which was a treat at $7.

Enjoyed sitting on the padded leather window seat and soaking up a lot of sunshine through the large picture windows.

This place has a nice, early evening buzz to it.
author: Carole B.

description: Such a cute wine bar! Use the check-in offer for two free tasting. Decentally sized wine list and the snacks looked good.
author: Kelly G.

description: Beautiful atmosphere and my now favorite Tuesday spot. On Tuesday's they offer a deal $25 house wine (red or white) and cheese platter. I'm a fan but our bartender didn't really seemed to want to be there. Overall really enjoyable atmosphere.
author: Nick F.

description:
I came to The Pour House on a Friday night with a girl friend for good conversation over wine and cheese. We both ordered flights, which was very reasonably priced at $12 and a cheese plate. The atmosphere was intimate and laid back, which is great for a chill outing! 

The only reason why I give 4 stars instead of 5 is that our waiter was somewhat rude and hard to get a hold of even when there weren't many other customers there.
author: Elyssa C.

description: Chilled champagne. Same-same, but different with the reviews here.  Casual, easy to get in without a reservation. Belgian beers, beers from all over the world.
author: Antigone S.

description:
I'm a big fan of the Pour House! Here are a few of the reasons why:

- the atmosphere is cute, cozy, and casual. There's a mini fireplace, one table in a big window overlooking Polk Street, and sometimes live music!
- the wine is reasonably priced; you won't find the fanciest wines but you can get a decent glass starting around $6
- you can buy a bowl of olives or mixed nuts for about $2. I think they're from Costco but they still taste delicious if you're looking for a small bite alongside your wine!
- you can bring in your own food :)

I've often suggested Pour House as a spot to go out with friends and plan on visiting again soon!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Great cozy atmosphere!
Friendly service!
Dog friendly!
Clean bathrooms!
Warm fireplaces!
Dark corners to make out in!

I think I've found my neighborhood bar to hang out with Coco, my shibe, at!

Thanks for a great night, Pour House!
author: Teresa T.

description: Still 5 stars and I love it even more, if possible. Like the wine, it just gets better as I get older. (See below for my full review earlier on)
author: Salma R.

description:
This bar was a really nice find when I was walking the neighborhood. I heard the acoustic guitar playing as I walked by the door and was drawn in! It had a lovely atmosphere, very warm and friendly. 

Mostly a wine bar but they had some good beers as well. They don't really have a good menu, mainly just bar snacks or cheese plate. I had the artichoke and jalapeño dip. It was delicious. 

Having been in the city a couple of days for work it was really my first real positive experience in the city so thank you for that!
author: Mike T.

description: I enjoyed my night here. I was here on a Friday night after Santa con, probably not the ideal timing for a wine bar. But, I can say that I did check in and get two free tastings and did enjoy the wine that the bartender served me. It is a small and cozy place on Polk street, if you are looking a wine place and lid back night in Polk, this is your stop.
author: Ross S.

description: Super nice place with great wine and friendly staff. Big +++ that we could charge our phones on the bar and discuss nearby dinner offers with Ryan and Mary Helen. Go there for a great time!
author: Roadtrip T.

description:
The staff is always very welcoming and friendly. It's a perfect date spot and you can get wine flights when you just can't make up your mind on what to drink. 

I LOVE that they are dog friendly. It makes happy hour super easy to go to.
author: Desiree P.

description:
Liam and Cindy were awesome, enjoyed a great Pinot and hope to come back for a Chardonnay soon. I'm not much for wine bars but tonight seemed like a great time to get into the wine bar scene in the city .

Definitely not your regular Polk street bar / lounge , I would suggest bringing your own twist to life and meeting new friends (with the bar tenders? They offer their seats apparently ) .

Definitely worth a quick stop.
author: Enpo T.

description: I love a glass of Old Vine Zin while chilling with a friend.  The interior is dark, homey and the music, while sometimes loud, is not terribly annoying.  This is a nice non-pretentious place for a first date or just to catch up with homies.  I am not a fan of the charcuterie plate here, but the wine list is more than decent!
author: Hiromi N.

description: Friendly, helpful bartenders and decent wine. It is quiet and nice in the early evenings. Dark, like I like it, clean and comfortable too! Great place to come with a date.
author: January B.

description:
More of a meet up place as opposed to a date night place for sure.  We went to Amelie beforehand, but it was so packed so we ended up here.  They don't have too much selection for wines by the glass.  There was only one "sweeter" wine option (Riesling) as opposed to going really sweet with a Moscato.  Casual nibbles to purchase to accompany your wine.  Service was fine from our waitress.  

Prices were decent, but there is a $15 minimum for credit card charges.  It's probably my least favorite wine bar I've been to but a good alternative to the typical bars, lounges and clubs on Polk...because if you're like me, you're so over your raging days.  3 by default.
author: Cat C.

description:
What a nice little wine bar on polk street. What a great name first of all and the setup is actually kind of refreshing. There is a lot happening on  polk street. When you go out on a Friday or Saturday night it can get hectic with all the drunk people and yelling. It is nice to be able to slide into a place like this and feel like you are off the beaten path. 

I love wine bars and this place did not disappoint. I especially liked the vibe in the place. They were playing some of the silliest shit I have ever heard played in a bar let alone at a wine bar. They went from 70's to tone loc to backstreet boys to tlc all within an hour. I couldn't tell what would be played next and it was a game to sit with my date and try to talk over what the next crazy song would be. What is great is the people there loved it. I think that is actually they vibe they are going for there. A weird wine bar and they are proud of it. 

It keeps the pretentious people out which is a great thing for me. It was never too crowded when I went there. The staff was always nice and the ladies behind the bar were wonderful. When i last went there was a couple that was making out the whole time. They got so into each other they climbed on top of each other and spilled their drinks on my date. The bartender came over and gave us free drinks for having to put up with them. The best part was the couple didn't stop. I had to turn around as hands started going under shirts!

The first time i went my date was terrible and the bartender knew it wasn't going well for me so she filled my drinks extra heavy and winked at me as my date continued to talk about her love for donald trump and other absurd things. This place will always hold a special place in my heart because of that. 

There aren't actually a lot of choices for wine here which is odd for a wine bar but the choices they do have were satisfying and you really aren't looking for anything to special when you are wine bar hopping on polk street. It is a great place to check out if you are done with dinner but want drinks or want to go out on a date or with friends but not face the college frat and marina crowds in Mcteagues and other places on polk. Keep being weird Pour House and I will keep coming back!
author: Nick R.

description:
My girlfriend and I went here on a Saturday night. We ordered the California reds to share, which was a selection of three wines. The wines were served in shot glasses rather than wine glasses, which I felt was reasonably unprofessional, but was forgivable considering the flight was only $14.

The pours were fairly small, but again we paid only $14 so we didn't expect much. I tried the first wine and it was awful. It tasted like cat piss. I'm not one to complain and I generally like most wines that I taste, but this was just dreadful. My girlfriend had already tried the first two wines and she said the second one was worse. I tried that one and she was right. It tasted like the cat had dropped a turd before he pissed on it. Finally I tried the last wine and it was just blatantly and unquestionably corked. Each wine was just utterly undrinkable; I would have much preferred they served us three glasses of two buck chuck instead.

It was an interesting experience really. The first wine was the worst wine I had ever had. But as I tried each successive wine, they only got progressively worse as each new tasting unseated the previous for the title of inglorious horribleness. The service was pretty awful too, but that may have been because I was loudly complaining to my girlfriend about how bad the wines were. When someone finally came I emphatically spoke my mind about the barely touched wines. She dumped them out and gave us the full bill.

I'm not one to complain about restaurants or bars. This was the only time in my entire life I've ever sent anything back or complained to a server about the quality. But something is not right here. If there's one establishment of any kind I would recommend someone not go to, it is the Pour House in Nob Hill.
author: Aaron G.

description:
While I sat in the pleasant window seat with a flight of bubbly and some cheese I wondered how long would I sit unmolested in the open-air breeze? Took about 30 minutes before one of the City's coddled male misogynist bums forced me from the open window into a cute as heck cubby-hole seat. The server was at first occupied with something online, I had to ask two helpful women drinking if anyone was working there. Minus one point for that, son. Be happy and helpful to have a job in this economy, right?

Very romantic. I'd take my husband but he recently died. Toast in his honor.
author: SF T.

description: Bar hopping on Polk is my new favorite hobby and I'm so glad I found the pour house! My friend and I customized our own flight and got two free pours with the Yelp check-in. The service was great, and the manager ended up talking to us for a long time! At first it was weird because we didn't know he was the manager, but when it was all cleared up, it made out to be a good time! Super intimate though, so it would be a great place for a date night! But, overall, it was way more fun than most wine bars I've been to, so I look forward to going back!
author: Megha M.

description: Love this wine bar and ALWAYS drop in when we're around this part of town. Lovely wines, friendly and understated service & a really nicely designed place to boot. One of my fav places to relax after dinner in SF.
author: Fi M.

description:
Great wine & they serve Sierra Nevada!

It's a great place to start the New Years, especially if you traveled from Southern California on your own just for exploration's sake. The waiters are cool, but I can sense tiredness in them, that I understand. They have comfortable sofas for the couple type and it has a calm vibe.

It's also not that far from the hotel I stayed at. I can walk around the beautiful city and then enjoy some wine and beer to unwind from walking all over the place. Will be back if I'm in San Francisco again.
author: Vincent V.

description:
Mellow atmosphere, decent selection of wine and small eats. Bartender working tonight has tried all the wines and offered her take on the wines. Every wine tried was excellent. Happily gave me tastes if I was unsure. Prices seems about right for the location and selection.

I will definitely return.
author: Noah A.

description: Liam is the most gracious owner and host. He made us feel so welcome during the very busy Santacon last night--while he seemed to be everywhere in the beautiful bar attending to an amazing experience for all. We will definitely be back. Thank you!
author: Wendy A.

description: Super chill place. I loved the live local music and good wine; it was all I could hope for in San Francisco. Close and easy to get to from my hotel. Only couples were there but it was a Monday so I overlook that. If I lived in the city I'd visit often. I just had one red flight but the menu was good...small but good. They even had a petite sirah.
author: Gayle S.

description: Lovely quiet goodness - stuck here waiting for car repairs and found this lovely lovely spot - will need to find a way to get back here!
author: Tamas G.

description:
My husband and I are huge fans of Amelie; when we stopped in on a Saturday night, we sadly realized that a large group was celebrating a 30th birthday, so there wasn't an open seat in the place.  As such, we ventured down Polk Street to the Pour House.

Compared to Amelie and other similar wine bars we've been to, this place doesn't stand out.  The ambiance, wine/food selecitons are nowhere near that of Amelie in particular.   That being said, it's still a good "back-up" option in Nob Hill if Amelie is super crowded (which has been the case on a number of occassions).

My husband and I both did flights (it's cheaper if you do the "couple" wine flight).  I can't remember which wines came in our flights, other than the fact that they had a sparkling and two reds.  Regardless, none of the wines were spectacular - I particularly didn't care for one of mine at all (my husband helped me with that one).  I wouldn't call myself a "wine snob" - but I done see the point in wasting time on bad wine.  If we come back, I'll be more selective in my wine choices, and skip the "pre-chosen" wine flights they have to offer.
author: Rachael S.

description:
I stumbled upon this place because as my boyfriend and I were walking by to go to the bar on the corner we heard Christina Aguilera music coming out of the pour house and I just had to walk in and finish hearing the song. Once I walked in I loved it because of the relaxing/chill vibe and the awesome furniture made out of wine barrels. We sat down in a comfy loveseat near the entrance  and we were greeted by the bartender with a list of wines they offered. 

Looking over the menu we decided to try a flight of red wines and it was a good time. 

Our bartender was very friendly and very knowledgeable on wines. Once we told her what kind of wines we liked she gave us a couple suggestions and we took them, and so glad we did because they were good!  We will definitely be back!
author: Jennifer R.

description: So glad to find this wine bar! They also serve beer, but I really enjoyed the reasonably priced wine flights and wine specials. They often do special events, and last night there was a group opera performance which was fantastic! I hear there will be a flamenco performance next month :) Friendly bar staff. Only downside is that they don't really serve much food -- just bar snacks like pickles, peanuts and cheese.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Came here for happy hour the other day which ends at 6pm.  The bartender said I was just in time for the specials, then proceeded to hand me a menu which I foolishly assumed was for happy hour.  My mistake!  At the end of the night we noticed she had charged us full-price for our drinks.  When I asked about the charges I was told  "you didn't order happy hour wines" then the bartender magically pulled out a different menu which she curtly claimed she had told me about.  We ended up paying full price. 

The service was otherwise non-existent.  There is one person working the entire place (bartending, busing, serving).  Others joined our group later on and we were ignored for a good 20 minutes until we flagged down the woman to order.

Given that there are so many other drinks places in the area this one is worth skipping.
author: Andrea L.

description:
This bar is a hidden gem! I discovered it only by accident and almost want to keep it all for myself. 

This is a quiet place with nice relaxing atmosphere and great wines - best place for having a great conversation with a friend. Needless to say, my best friend and I go there all the time.

If you are sick of crazy loud American bars, this place is perfect for you!
author: Sofya N.

description: I really love this place! Went there for the first time, really cool spot to drink great wine with friends or on a date, I love that they also have a band that plays music!
author: Diane P.

description:
Nice little wine bar on Polk Street but nothing to travel to go to. We stayed close by and dropped in as we felt like some more wine after the initial days spent visiting wineries in Napa Valley. The place looks OK, sort of a cheap feel to the interior but there is nothing wrong with it.

To be a wine bar the selection of wine was surprisingly small but they seem to be more of a cheaper wine bar. Tried a chardonnay and a pinot noir, both were good but nothing worth remembering. 

The bartender was pleasant enough but did not seem that interested in wines (have never seen someone struggling so much when opening a bottle of sparkling for another group so almost seemed he was new at the job) 

It was easy to get a seat here and the ambiance was relaxed so it was great as a place to be able to sit down and talk at.
author: Mathias H.

description:
This Place is really lovely. It is dim lit- very romantic. The wine selection is phenomenal. and the staff is very friendly. I enjoy coming here and logging on to wifi and doing some homework while I sip on a Pinot Noir. 

Keep up the good work guys!
author: Sami B.

description: I love this place so much! Came here on a Friday after work just needing a glass of wine and it was great. They have the best selection of wine. Pre warning they are not a full stock bar, just wine and beer. They have great snacks as well like cheese plates, olives, and nuts, basically anything that goes well with wine. Megan was my server and she was so nice and so knowledgable with all the wines. I tried a wine, didn't like it, and she recommended another wine and it was great. It's a very chic place and it fun with friends or an intimate date. Great place! I would highly recommend.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
Went the Pour House due to the reviews and came away disappointed. Nice wine list and nice cheese platter but the service on Sunday night was appalling. 

Barman was way more interested in serving the already inebriated lady sitting at the bar than doing his job. 

Empty glasses sat on the bar for 10-15 mins and eye contact could not be made with barman. 

Finally called for check (again after 10 mins of barman playing with his phone, talking to lady, serving lady, texting lady). 

Need to look at what makes the Pour House rate so well and make sure every staff members works to the same drum beat because our night was a disappointment.
author: Stuart R.

description: I had the opportunity of patronizing this fine establishment last night 5/27/16. It was GRAND to say the least. The Moscow Mules are GREAT. Clean, classy upscale bar. Can't wait to come back!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Absolutely love this place, every time I  visit  the music is really  upbeat l, the lighting is amazing. And I can't say enough about the staff - tell Sarah hello!! :-)

When you first walk in and sit-down they let you sample the wines , before you order  a glass which is I thought was  very  nice.

If you're looking for a clean well-run place you found it.

I've been in several times and always get the  wine flights. Oh , and their wines they change them up all the time and you're always surprised by the selections . 

They also can recommend cheese pairings to go with the wine.

Actually heading there Thursday for a birthday party  !!!!
author: Laura S.

description:
It's no secret that I love wine and, duh!, wine bars. Plus after a long hiatus, I'm starting fall back in love with beer. Ideally, the Pour House should be the meeting of two fabulous worlds, but it was just OK.

Some friends picked me up along the way so I didn't have to worry about relying on mass transit in the city. That immediately put me in a good mood. Plus it was Friday night - TGIF!

As we walked in, there was late '90's pop music blaring. At a wine bar? Really? We giggled and grabbed a booth. The boys ordered beers and my gal pal and I each had a glass of vino. The beers were awesome! The wine? Meh, not so much. It was a generous pour, though, especially for a $6 glass. So cheers to quantity over quality. My friends also ordered a cheese plate, which came out with mixed nuts, olives and two different kinds of cheese. They ate most of it, so I can't speak for that part of our experience. 

Since the music overhead kept getting louder and worse, we decided to leave. It wasn't offensive or anything, just not the kind of vibe we were going for. With many other awesome wine bars in SF and beyond, I just wasn't that impressed. But if I was in the 'hood and wanted a cheap glass of wine, this would be a good place to start.
author: Abby S.

description:
It's rare that a bartender is able to pull off being pretentious and rude while also managing to be uneducated and slow, but the staff here nails it. The owners must have done an exhaustive search for two minutes on Craigslist to find someone who's incompetence is bested only by their bad attitude. 

On the other hand, I was impressed with the food pairings. I know it isn't easy to find a Costco near SF so they must have really gone out of their way to track down that bland artichoke dip to pair with the uninspired beer and wine selection.

Plenty of better options in the neighborhood.
author: Jack H.

description: wednesday stop little past six...happy hour ends at six...near empty and seating plenty...at the bar and wine pours the main focus...regular pricing roughly $ten plus/minus total and glass of wine...taste given of choice...bit too murky dull...bartender recommending something different...much better!..nice quiet bar for glass of wine and tasting...
author: Hen A.

description: Owner himself greeted us as we walked into an absolutely packed bar on New Years and gave us the best table in the house. If that isn't five star service, I don't know what is. Wish I lived in this city to come here more.
author: Sean M.

description: An a-ok place to pass the time. Crowd seems to be older so you can avoid the Polk St. / Real World douche storm.
author: Susy C.

description:
We spontaneously walked into Pour House on a Thursday date night... thought we could grab a few drinks before dinner and were pleasantly surprised by how much we liked our random choice!

Service - Just one lady working that night but crowd was small enough where we all were well taken care of. Also, she poured a huge glass of wine (hello double thumbs up) 

Drink  - Great big selection of wine. BF loved the beer even though that was obviously a smaller selection. You can try both beer and wine before taking full glass. 

Food - didn't try it! But from what we saw, they partner with a nearby restaurant (thai??) that will bring food right to your seat. 

Atmosphere - really chill... part lounge, part new age. I dig it.
author: Amy C.

description: Confusingly aggressive service (I wasn't drinking that night but I was there to meet a friend and I couldn't end a sentence without a bartender asking if I wanted something yet) and high prices, but the ambiance is nice.
author: Cecilia A.

description:
Pour is a cute and relatively inexpensive wine bar located on Polk St. in Russian Hill. We went on a Saturday night and didn't have any problems finding a seat and the bartender was quick to come over welcome us and help us pick out a bottle of wine for our group. Out of all the bottles I surprised that he recommended one of the cheaper
Bottles on the menu. We ordered the Pinotage Ernst Gouws & Co 2010 from South Africa. It's a red and has a really bold kinda fruity and smokey flavor to it! The bottle ran us 26.00 and they charged us 1.00 for a bowl mixed nuts. At the end of the night they told us that they sell all of their bottles of wine for 40% off of the listed price on the menu! 
Only downside is that as soon as we walked in (9:00) the jazz band was packing up to leave. I love live music and would make this part of my rotation if they had music late on weekends!
But over all we had a great time and for 5 people and our bill only being 35.00, I am sold.
author: Roxy H.

description:
I've stopped in many times for HH...I really can't get over $3 glasses of wine, huge pours mind you.  There are usually plenty of open table/bar seats and I love the open window seating. Makes for excellent people watching on good ol' Polk St. 

Minus one star because there has always been discrepancies between a) what the website says b) what their outdoor signage says and c) what the bartenders say regarding happy hour pricing and times.  Simple fix: streamline your info! That said, they always accommodate when I mention the website content.
author: Brianna M.

description:
The Pour House is such a cozy and unassuming neighborhood watering hole. I've passed it many times without really looking in but I'm glad I finally stopped by for happy hour. 

Firstly, they have LaChouffe! Oh I've missed the golden sweet aroma from this Belgian dwarf. It was so awesome to taste it again and so few places in the city stock it. Needless to say, The Pour House has an amazing beer selection and we had quite a few other rare brews here. 

Service is really friendly although the bartender can get a little swamped when it's crowded. Still he was really appreciative for our business and I can't wait to be back. The Pour House is totally on my list for happy hour in the neighborhood.
author: Jon L.

description: Love the wine flights. Quick and friendly service and good pours :)
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Great bartender.

I didn't love anything that was on their list of white wines and the bartender recommended a moscato. I'm a sweet wine kind of girl and this was delicious! 

Wines on tap, beers and all sorts of wines on Polk Street. So much classier than some of the places just down the street.
author: Nina Y.

description:
This place is a solid 2. 

We walked in here last night because it looked cute and quiet enough to have a conversation on a Friday night in anotherwise busy and loud Polk St scene. 

They have a decent selection of wine,  I tired a few, wasn't overly impressed by any of them.  The bartender was unhelpful and had one of the stingiest pours I have ever seen. Definitely not worth the 7 - 12$ per glass price range they have. 

The ambiance is the only savior for this less than inspiring wine bar. I definitely won't be coming back.
author: Krithika H.

description:
I have been to this place twice, and while I would not return, I do have to say that the bartender really tries. 

The good: The first time I was offered the happy hour deal past happy hour, which was nice of the bartender. The second time the bartender offered a free sample glass before purchasing a bottle.

The bad: One man was running the whole show. It took about 30 minutes to get served. The bar food is pretty bad, and the selection worse.

Bottom Line: Good for a quick drink, if you have a long time to wait around and do not wish to eat a bar snack. Priced well. Worth checking out, just do count on quite a wait before being served.
author: Sam M.

description:
Wine good. Service not so much. The guy did not seem to know much about the wines on his menu. My friend asked if a Sauvignon Blanc was sweet or dry and he seemed confused as to what that meant. He barely checked on our party even though there was no one else in the place. He was more concerned with his online shopping he was doing on his computer than with his customers. Hopefully he bought the necklace he was searching for so that some good came of the day. 

On the other hand, the wine was great, I had the custom flight and really enjoyed it and the ambience was nice. Service really makes a difference though, a lot of places have great wine.
author: Alana S.

description:
Great place to meet with friends  and talk for hours. 
This place has live music at the evening. Great atmosphere there as well. 
They have a place in the back for a big party if you want to celebrate a Bday or any event. Good place on the crowed Polk street.
author: Anna M.

description: Love this place. It's such a cool and cozy ambiance with barrels as tables and high stools. When we got there the waiter promptly greeted us and had us seated at a corner with ample space for a 6-8 people. I love the merlot and cabs and I can't even remember what they were. It's a very chill place without overly loud music. Will definitely be back.
author: Kristina K.

description: I'm already a big fan of this place thus far! Last Friday me an my friend came across this place and fell completelty on love! Our bartrnder was super sweet and attentive eventhough it was her second day when I was there. The owner Liam was down to earth an such a sweetheart. I admired how he was helping out his own staff by washing the dishes and contributing in so many ways. The ambiance and music was on point!  I'm definitely coming back and bringing more friends! Keep up the good work!
author: Bri R.

description:
Have been here twice. We really like the cozy vibe and welcome feeling we get when there. It's a wine bar and have only had the wine and a cheese plate. I had a Cabernet Sauvignon first time and a red wine flight on the second visit.
Service is generally friendly, sometimes a bit slow but always friendly. 
They have a small area in the back where performers play on occasion. 
High point: good prices and good wine and cheese
Low point: sometimes slow service.
Chances we will go back ? Yes and already have. I can see this becoming a regular place for us.
author: Mike Z.

description: Great spot for girls night out, I was so disappointed that I was sick!  I loved how much space we had when we were sitting at the tables towards the front, and it also makes for some great people watching when you're sitting by the windows!  The only part about Pour House that I had a hard time with is that if you don't drink (or are sick in my case, but still wanting to be social), your only option is warm tap water.  I'm sure that begs the question of whether you should be in an alcohol environment or not, but again, all I wanted was another option.  Definitely will come back when my health returns to me!
author: Lisa I.

description:
We've been here multiple times since we found it. They serve Boneyard, which is an instant "4", but more importantly, I'm reviewing because they have pretty decent BBQ.

I'm from Kansas City, and well traveled throughout the SE, Texas, and Midwest in terms of BBQ. Admittedly I'm a snob about it.

When we moved to Central Oregon, we couldn't find decent BBQ to fulfill our unhealthy appreciation. (Sorry guys, the PNW just has no idea what BBQ is...)

I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the BBQ (and the BBQ-esque sides as well). It's actually the closest thing I've found here in Deschutes County to legit BBQ. Slick's is another good option we've found, but they don't have Boneyard Beer, and they're moving to Redmond, sadly.

Burgers are great, too. Garlic fries are badass. Good atmosphere, and not loud as hell when you're trying to enjoy a conversation with friends over dinner. Staff is friendly, helpful, and attentive without being annoyingly overbearing.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The last time I went here was when it was S.N.O.B.  (Sonoma, Napa, or Beyond) which I thought was a cute name.  Now that it's The Pour House, the atmosphere is a lot more fun, and less serious.  I like the new name... (full disclosure, I've always gotten a kick out of hair salons with names like "A Cut Above" etc.)

Big props for having hooks under the bar.  Honestly, if it's 2010, soon to be 2011, and a bar doesn't have hooks, that's a 2 star reduction in my book.  So, yay for hooks!

I loved the wine list as well as the beer list.  (If you've read my other reviews, you know I really appreciate a descriptive beer list.)  Last night I had a fantastic petite syrah.  Nice glassware too.  I arrived after happy hour had ended, but it's good to know for the future.  Bartenders were friendly and attentive.
author: Chloe M.

description:
Cute little wine bar, but not really anything special in my opinion. Ordered a cheese platter to accompany our wine; I think the person who usually puts together the food wasn't there or something? We got a haphazardly assembled plate of cheese and crackers, and had to pay 10 bucks for it.

Still not opposed to going back because it's in my neighborhood and the bartender was kind of nice. Wine selection was decent, too.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
My favorite thing about this place is your ability to sit and enjoy a wine flight while the thai place (chai-yo) next door brings you food on nice plates. 

The bartenders I have had here have been pretty good. The wine flights are great and not too pricey, and its a cool intimate setting. They sometimes have someone playing the piano or some music in the back, which is a nice addition. 

If planning a night here, you may want to call ahead and check as they sometimes have events... I have happened upon two speed dating events. This kind of takes up the space, so in the future I will call ahead to make sure its not one of those nights.
author: Jess K.

description: Went here during Santa Con. Had a bunch of seats and some pretty good wines. Honestly can't remember much about the night, unfortunately. However, this does seem like a great place to just chill and hang out.
author: Ruobin W.

description: The pour house is one of my fav spots to grab a nice glass of wine after work! They have a pinot noir for only $5 during happy hour! It's a great spot for first dates or just a night out with the girls! Also the Thai place delivers so you can enjoy delicious food to compliment your glass of wine. My favorite is the Brady Cabernet! Also the pours are decent sized and prices are reasonable!
author: Chae K.

description:
Almost didn't post this after seeing all the great reviews but... Very disappointed. I work in the area and have passed this place more than a dozen times. 2 stars because the location is cool, the name is clever and I don't have it in my heart to give 1 star. My experience at POUR HOUSE was like buying infomercial anything; not as good as advertised. 

Now I understand you're on Polk street and this is an easy sell to weekday warriors who are ignorant to good wines but really? The name is "POUR HOUSE" with a wine glass on the signage. So, show me the money [wines]! Half of the wines on the wine list were unavailable and 3 of the 4 wines we requested, the bartender asked us, "What kind of wine is that?" 

After our bartender broke the cork of our 2004 Rutherford merlot, my colleagues meticulously removed the remaining slivers as best as they could but a few shards still dropped in. No cheese cloth to filter the cork. And no decanter. (No decanters at a wine bar?!? #dafuq???) Yea, I might sound wine snobbish but it's a friggin wine bar!

We dumped the first pour really hard to get the cork remnants out and enjoyed the 2004 vintage, which was surprisingly wonderful for 2004 not being a "good year" in Napa. We asked our bartender for a pint glass to filter out the cork in that first glass that we set aside. The bar tender looked at us with confusion and wonder at the request for a "pint glass" to which we responded, "That glass that you pour a beer in." *lightbulb* 

All in all it was a sad face experience. The look and feel of the place is awesome and if you don't give a crap about El Vino, and the depths of it's majesty, and just want some cool atmosphere that serves the juice, this is a good spot to hang. 

I've left the bartender's name and description anonymous because he/she was very nice and did his/her best, but I am embarrassed for the owner that that person is a representative of a wine bar. My suggestion to said owner is to have weekly wine tastings for employees so that they can become educated on what they are pouring at POUR HOUSE, to have an current list of what is available, and to have a GREAT semi-secret stash for people who come in actually knowing about wine. There are a lot of service industry folk who roam around polk street who would enthusiastically back a place like this, if it were worthy. If this place actually held expertise in the niche it fronts to claim, POUR HOUSE could be one of those places that young, trendy winos with networks of great people would have a culty kind of love for. It could be a place where both a 2 buck chuck wine lover and a 5 year veteran server from a top steakhouse can both call home, and be excited to bring their friends. It's kinda whomp whomp to see an establishment claim their lane but not rock it out. Many reviews say it isn't busy here most of the time. If that's the way the owners like it, then great. For now, I'm rudely disappointed. But I look forward to coming back and hopefully updating my review with something better to say.
author: Noreen J.

description: Nice little spot to grab a glass of wine or some beers. Good beers on tap, go with the Dogfish 90 Min IPA or the Sierra Nevada extra IPA. Intimate environment and nice calm little spot kick back with a friend or S/O. Plus Megan is a kickass bartender and always has good recommendations!
author: Justin K.

description: Nice little wine bar on Polk had a Prosecco and coke. TV and music and a little dark but nice alternative to other bars in the area.
author: N A.

description:
Great little wine bar.

Nice dark intimate sitting areas for romance or just some good convo with friends, cute fire burn near the corner window, dogs are welcome (not sure about all the time, but a sign outside said on Tuesdays), small cheese selection, friendly/knowledgeable bartenders, good wine selection, beers on tap, no pretentiousness, and the music isn't too noisy so you can hear the person next to you. I'll be back with more friends Pour House, Oh I'll be back!
author: Krystle L.

description: I've been here 3-4 times and each experience was awesome! I love the decor-with the wine barrels and romantic lighting, you really get the full experience of being in a wine bar. Last time I went in Megan the bartender gave us great service and was really fun to talk to. This is a great place for date night or girls night out.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
To this day, I still remember Pour House describes on the bottom of their beer list: "PBR: light bodied and refreshing!"  

Love that.  Thanks for not being pretentious.  (Even if you do charge too much for aforementioned beer.)
author: Keeks K.

description:
We just hosted our engagement party at The Pour House and it was a total success.  We found this wine bar one night over a year ago after we had seen a movie on Van Ness.  The thing we really like about this place is it's not uptight like some wine bars.  The atmosphere is laid back and inviting and the bartenders are friendly and helpful.  You don't feel like you have to know a lot about wine (like some wine bars).  They're happy to help with suggestions.  The prices are great and they also have a great beer selection if wine isn't your thing.

Back to our event - Chase and Nelson were the bartenders and they were awesome. We had between 50 and 60 people show up between 630 and 9 and I never heard anyone complain that they had to wait for their drinks.  Everyone had a great time.  When we walked in at first they were playing pretty loud rock, maybe even heavy metal.  I was surprised that heavy metal type rock would be playing at a wine bar ever... kind of a turn off. Chase was accomodating and took our requests for the music we liked for the night, which is awesome, but I can say that if I was just coming in for a drink that kind of music wouldn't make me want to stay.  

They didn't charge us to host our party in their bar which was awesome but we were a little disappointed that there were no deals whatsoever or something complimentary, like maybe something as simple as a bottle of champagne for us.  It would have been a nice gesture as we did give them a LOT of business on a Thursday night.  Also there was a calendar online that said wine was $1 off between 6-8 on Thursdays (event was April 5) and I'm pretty sure that discount wasn't passed on to our guests. http://www.sfpourhouse.com/calendar

The guy in charge of events wasn't very responsive so it was hard to plan our event.  At one point I asked for a list of food options and he never responded.  We decided to make our own arrangements and bring food in.  I got an email from him 4 days later asking about a head count.  When I told him we'd be bringing food of our own in he then told me we would have to purchase 4-5 platters in addition to the food we brought in.  We most likely would have bought platters from them but the lack of response made me feel like he didn't care so I didn't want to spend more money on food through them.  I almost felt like I was trying so hard to make the event work out, instead of the other way around.  
I believe in constructive criticism so hopefully they'll heed these comments and change the way they handle communication for future events.
author: Alisa M.

description: What a fun place. Wine, beer and bubbly only--but you won't miss the spirits. Why you say?! Because this place has charisma, yes I said it, charisma. Initimate setting, fun lively bartenders, great selection of wine and beer and a cozy, "makes me want to come back ASAP" vibe. Great addition to Polk and to the SF beer and wine scene.
author: Shira O.

description: We stumbled in here ( literally) last night and LOVED it!  The decor is classy, the owner was one of the bar tenders who was super friendly and attentive.  Stellar music embodied the space and we danced and had a great time.   We ordered the bar nuts and pickles.  Whoa.  They were damn good and the owner gave us seconds, free!  I would def go back. Great spot on Polk!!!  Great mellow crowd , too.
author: Tracy K.

description: Went here with my boytoy and it was fabulous~ The wine here would satisfy even the most snobby wino. Come here posh and ready to drink peasants
author: Elaine C.

description: Been wanting to come here for a while. This place is great. Cozy, intimate atmosphere. Exceptional staff. Sarah, or Sara (sorry if I butchered the spelling!) was a great host. I recommend the flight for the wines. This is a place to come, get a glass of wine and enjoy of few hours of conversation. Will come back here periodically.
author: JD F.

description:
They have Dogfish head 90 minute IPA on tap here.

And they don't screw around either--a lot of places where I've seen the 90 min give you a crappy 10oz pour for six bucks.  Here you get the whole pint.

I thought the ambiance red interior was nice, but my girlfriend wasn't buying it.  They serve food from the Thai restaurant next door if your hungry.

Oh did I mention they have Dogfish head 90 minute IPA on tap here?
author: Rocco B.

description: Great staff! This one lady was very nice and assisted us with the menu. I know I might be deceiving by my young looks but it was funny how she asked if me and my friend were 21 yet. :P great interior with awesome furniture, those barrel tables and beautiful candles gets me!
author: Karen J.

description: Such a cool little spot with perfect ambiance. I came here on a Sunday so it was on the mellow side. The bartender was very attentive and personable. I got a cheese plate and a glass of cab. Both very generous and soooo good!
author: Jeni J.

description:
I can't review the wine (since we didn't have any) but the service was amazing.  The bartender was fun, willing to engage in conversation and helpful.  We were trying their selection of Belgian beers and he knew about each one, had recommendations for each pallet and his favorites.  Also they had overcharged us due to a St. Patty's day deal they had going on and they refunded us the difference.  Nice to see the honesty.

I want to come back to try their wine selection.  Just happened to stop in on a beer kind of day.
author: Sutton A.

description: I LOVE this place. This is literally one of the best places to get a glass of wine in the city. The interior is chic and the bartenders are super friendly. The music is awesome as well. My favorite bartender is Sarah!!! She is really nice, super attentive and provides excellent service. Wonderful place to meet up with your friends or date and have a glass of tasty wine. I'd give it 10 stars if I could.
author: Deena W.

description:
It took a little searching, but we found the Pour House tucked into the scaffolding. The place looked deserted but, we ducked in anyway to find Nelson tidying up the bar/ lounge. As I took my stool, I looked around to see The Matrix was playing on one of the flat screens with a pretty good variety of music playing in the background. The Pour house is a cozy, warm, welcoming spot. Its dark with red re-purposed laundry bin lights setting an intimate kind of mood.    

Nelson took good care of us, offering us Ghiradeli chocolates with our wine choices. He was very knowledgeable and suggested things off the menu.  I'm not the biggest wine drinker but a  flight of red or white wine for $12 bucks sold me on my first visit. When we left the place was packed, I mean who can pass up drink specials on a weekend?  

My second visit I sat we sat on one of the big couches in one of two  lounge areas (The other has re-purposed wine barrel tables and chairs/ booths. I opted for a "beer flight" complete with 21st Amendment brews "Back in Black" from the tap and an Anchor Steam Humming Ale. The next time I go, I'm gonna order from the Thai place next door in addition to taking advantage of the happy hour choices.

If you are looking for mixed drinks, The Pour House is not for you. Wine, beer and small appetizer plates (Thai Food, if you want to BYOF) awaits those looking for a local wine and beer lounge.
author: Dennis S.

description:
What a great little spot! We popped in here with a decent sized group for an after lunch continuation of a birthday celebration. We tried several of the selections, which are a bit limited, but I believe will grow with time. 
As a new player in town, I think they are doing a great job. It's an intimate little place, with some nice outdoor seating, and a little space for a live band. 
I don't recall there being any problems with service or space, and I know we were there for a good two hours. 
I am looking forward to coming back and trying some new wines.
author: Kelly B.

description:
It was friday night...my friend and i were already partially tipsy...but we had an hour to kill before our movie at the kubuki...and a friend was visiting SF and wanted to meet up for a quick drink during that time...so...our decision game plan unfolded this way...

First geography...we were in alamo going to japan town...she was in the marina headed nowhere...Polk Street it is!

Second Beverage...we had been drinking wine...the friend wanted wine...wine it is!

Third Bar...We told the taxi driver...drop us off somewhere on polk among the open bars and restaurants.  He dropped us off at Polk and Bush....We looked around...we saw the pour house...we looked inside...cool, swanky and pretty much empty...The Pour House it is!

The ambiance is kind of cool, dark, red, the menu isn't amazing but it has wine...prices are decent...quiet enough to have a conversation...and the bartender cute....so, for what we wanted it satisfied.
author: Kierstan G.

description:
Ways to make a single gal severely disgruntled:

1) Dress in ill-fitted clothing on a date.
2) Be a really bad conversationalist.
3) If you're the bartender, be really snotty.
4) And also make sure you ignore us/me, especially when I'm trying to flag you down for the bill so I can peace the eff out.

I wish my first impression of The Pour House wasn't so poor (hah!), but fear not, I haven't been scarred for life.  While it's a bit further up Polk St. than I usually wander, the cozy atmosphere and good selection of wine will definitely beckon me back sometime when I'm with better company.
author: Tori S.

description:
A nice escape. Ambient lighting, great music playing (server said it was just Pandora!), and an easy-going style. Decorations and seating aren't typical, somewhat of a Western touch.

Great selection with very very generous pours. Usually get the flights, and customize it!! Generous flights for $16 is really the biggest push to go here. I usually get 2 reds and a white, or all 3 reds. The Malbec is a charm. Quiet, not near any rowdiness found on Polk St. Great snacks here as well.

They have wine and beer, and the basics for those who aren't too fond of too much. It works out. Enjoy an hour or two here, and there's plenty of food around to help.

Have yet to go in when there's live music, have been meaning to! Sell retail as well. 

A nice spot for a few drinks, if you want to get away from crowds of people. Success to bring wine lovers from out of town too, like when my partner and I brought his wine loving parents, and another occasion, some of his friends from LA.

Enjoy the wine and the chats. Cheers!
author: Sophie C.

description:
This is not a wine bar, is a normal bar with some wines. A wine bar doesn't have that loud music. 
And what is worse, the bar is called the pour house but they don't know how to pour wine. Please someone has to tell the bartenders that the very last wine of the bottle is never poured because of the wine lees.
author: Victor G.

description:
Love love love the pour house! A great addition to my neighborhood. 
I've been here plenty of times and what I love most about this is that the crowd can always very from trendy hipsters, art students, business folk, and the casual passerby. And everyone is treated with the same exact attention.

I came here for a birthday the first time I came and we sat in the big table in the back. Won't lie- a few of us were intrigued by the big ladder by the bar and tried our best not to climb up! 

Service is always great, with very generous pours. The interiors have a very warm, comforting feel, without the fancy window dressings. 

If you don't think you can afford Amelie, a few blocks up post, this place is a great substitute and I can pronounce half the list (never was too good at french). 

Try it out! It's never been too crowded. Loves it
author: Amanda S.

description:
I haven't written a yelp review in a while, so I figured this would be a good way to get started.

Pour House is a great local bar with plenty of good drinks, friendly bartenders, and most importantly-- SPACE.  Finally, a place that isn't so packed (ahem Mayes) that you can actually hear one another (ahem McTeague's).
author: Julie L.

description:
A buddy invited me to get drinks here at the Pour House yesterday. If you know me, you'd know how much I hate driving to the city. Very few things are worth it for me. The first is going to Giants games. The second is driving by the stadium and wishing the Giants were playing during the off-season. And now, there's the Pour House.

They have a good drink menu here. Because I don't know my way around good wines quite yet, I was actually looking at the menu in confusion. The bartender probably saw the dopey look on my face, so he recommended the Red Wine Flight. 4 generous pours of their best red wines. Needless to say, they were all very good.

They've also got beer here, which is an instant plus for me. Unfortunately, they were sold out of the Dogfish Head when we visited. My friend and I were extremely sad. But the Duvel was a decent substitute.

One other thing, if you ever get hungry, you can actually order food from the Thai restaurant up the street (Chai-Yo, I think it was called). And they actually BRING IT TO YOU while you're at the bar! Again, win-win for both businesses. 

The bartender for the night (Nelson) was a very awesome dude. Giving good recommendations and always willing to help out his customers. A winning attitude for any business, in my opinion.

Overall, I WILL come back again (once I find some friends who know how to appreciate wine). Great service, good drinks, even better buzz. They even allow DOGS in there! Always awesome.
author: Daniel M.

description:
I'm just a little obsessed with the pour house.  It's my new favorite bar on polk street.

They only serve beer and wine, but their prices are very reasonable and their selection is nice.  I typically go for the Chimay or the Duvel, but I tried the Maroudsous triple the other night and I found my new favorite beer on the menu.  

The bar tenders are always nice and friendly.  They make great recommendations about what they serve, and play excellent music.  

I love the vibe of this place.  You won't come here for bumping and grinding.  It's quiet enough that you can have conversations without yelling, but dark and loud enough that you feel like you're not just sitting at home for the night.   And I'm a huge fan of the couches and futon, because who doesn't love reclining while imbibing a delectable brew?
author: Anne Marie B.

description:
Stopped in this place during Happy Hour and it was empty.  I had a glass of the Pinot Noir and it was ok nothing special.  Happy hour choices are pretty limited, they only offer one white and one red choice.  Food is not good and I don't recommend ordering it.  We tried the spinach and artichoke with crackers and it was basically a supermarket quality cold dip with wheat Keebler like crackers.  

They do seem to have a generous dog policy so I may return because my dog can come.  But otherwise it was a bit of a disappointment.
author: Lisa K.

description: Cozy place with dim lit ambiance - great for a date.  Plus not too noisy so you can hear each other without screaming.  Knowledgeable bartender.
author: Kim S.

description:
My birthday was officially on Monday and after a weekend of debauchery, I decided I wanted something mellow. Friends and I had some cheap (but delicious) pizza and then headed virtually next door to The Pour House for a glass of wine. When I'm on Polk I always go to Amelie so it was nice to discover a new spot! 

The zin I ordered was fantastic. If I knew how to describe wines well I'd go off on all the random things it tasted like but since I don't, I'll just stick with, YUM. One of my girlfriends mentioned it was my birthday and the adorable server comped our my glass. How sweet is that?! Can't wait to come back and try others.
author: Julia N.

description:
Love this place! Such a hidden gem and very no-frills. It's got a nice intimate feel to it - very cozy and wine bar esque... and enough space to have a gathering of friends, but also enough room to wander. We had great service consistently through the evening from Ryan (too bad he only works Tuesdays!) and he tailored suggestions to our specific needs. As a wine enthusiast, I am very particular about regions, and varietals, and he was spot on. Also, the wine flights are very affordable and the pours were substantial! And the cheese boards? Delicious and generous on the nuts and cheese cuts. Will definitely come back soon!

Also, for the sports aficionados - they have several great plasmas that were showing the games of the evening - Giants and Sharks I believe. Furthermore - you can bring in food from the neighboring pizzerias if you want a heartier meal. Good music choices too - love Band of Horses and Miike Snow!

Bottom line: caters to all crowds, laidback environment, good service, generous pours, TVs, well-priced, and good but rotating selection of wines!
author: Tammy H.

description:
This USED to be one of my favorite wine bars on Polk street and I have to say the service was not up to par last time I visited. I came here with some girlfriends on a Sunday night and our server was not very attentive. 

The bar was not overly crowded and he seemed more concerned with inventory than serving his patrons. We had to ask for our hummus plate 3 times after our first order and we were literally clapping and hollering to try to get his attention. He also gave us his unsolicited advice/ words of wisdom on relationships as we were consoling a friend who is going through a breakup. It was weird and rude since he never participated in our conversation to begin with.

The $13 flights have kept me coming back but I will consider another venue before I return.
author: Jacquie S.

description:
I like the vibe of the Pour House. It's comfy and you can hole up in one of the back tables with a friend or two and just enjoy good wines (great beer too) and some cheese & crackers. My idea of a good time.
I haven't been yet, but I hear they have art shows on Thursdays and bands on Tuesdays and Sundays. Looking forward to emptying more glasses with the Pour House crew.
author: Colleen B.

description:
Short but tasty selection of wines (both red and white varieties). Large pours.   

On-hand delivery menus compensating for limited cheese and cracker offering; next level wine-bar maneuver.  

Comfortable atmosphere of soft easy listening music from Tom Petty to the Postal Service that allows easy conversation. 

Very friendly bartender on my first visit who allowed a friend's dog to soak in the ambiance.  Not sure if this is standard.
author: J R.

description: Excellent low key place to grab a glass of wine after work or before dinner.  Service is friendly and attentive, no complaints. The  people watching is a plus and at 5.00 happy hour is icing on the cake.
author: Peanuts M.

description: This place is good if you are hosting a small event- good wine and beer and the bartenders are really nice. They let you call and reserve the area in the back which is also kind of nice. Only three stars because there is nothing that special or unique about the place and It's pretty crowded so if you aren't with a reserved event, its a little difficult. It's also really really filled with women which I guess may have something to do with it being a wine bar, but that's not generally my ideal...
author: Vinitha R.

description:
Went to grab a casual glass of Pinot on a Tuesday and the found the pour house...glad I did.

Wine is priced great and the setting/space is cozy, yet roomy and inviting. The bartender (think his name was Alex) was nice and helpful and very knowledgeable about wine. Made it nice to have a conversation with about the varieties of wine that they offered. I'll be back for sure. 

They did get rid of their board games though. BRING THEM BACK! It was such a great option. The owner needs to bring them back ASAP
author: Mike L.

description:
Great wine bar.... 

Nice bartenders, good cheese, and great wine! 

Good place to go for a mellow night, good conversation, and to just chill with friends. We got a flight of wine.... but I'm pretty sure our bartenders poured us way more than they should have in each glass :). 

I thought it was pretty inexpensive, at least compared to Press Club, which is the other wine bar I'v been to recently. 

Overall, I give it four stars... I really enjoyed my time there, but it is not a place I would seek out, unless I was already in the area.
author: Rona Y.

description: Great owner & very accommodating staff. Went there with friends for a bachelorette night, the owner treated us to drinks & let us stay beyond closing time for a friend's special night. Drinks were tasty & the people there were great. A very memorable night for me in sf:)
author: noelle m.

description:
The Pour House on Polk Street is a great place for a glass of wine or microbrew after work. It conveniently opens at 4pm, the time I think happy hour should start. The Pour House used to be SNOB (Sonoma, Napa or Beyond) but the subsequently changed the name and the vibe. SNOB was a bit pretentious and the service was about as rude as a NYC cab driver at 2am. I went twice before the name change and both times I felt as if I was inconveniencing the bartender by gracing her with my presence. But this has all changed, thankfully. 

The Pour House has turned into a fabulous low-key semi-hipster place. The new atmosphere is relaxed, there is plenty of seating with a long wood bar (with purse hooks), 3 overstuffed couches up front and a splattering of tables in the dark, romantic back of the bar. Unless you know the majority of the people sitting on the couches, it can be a bit awkward to sit there. My friend and I started out on the couches but later moved after a group of 5 sat down. I really felt I was invading someone's living room couch. So if you have space issues or don't like people listening to your conversation then pick a seat at the bar or one of the tables in the back.

The bar offers 40 different premium wines and 25 microbrews (10 on tap). The bartender on duty was a very nice young man who unfortunately went to UCONN (I didn't hold it against him, we still tipped). My only complaint is that the cheese plate is horrible. First off you have two cheese choices, Jarlsberg and an unidentified crumbled goat cheese. The two cheeses come with massive wheat crackers that do nothing to compliment the cheese. The best part was the dish of salty olives. If I wasn't so starved, I would have told him he could keep it after my first glance. Another food option is to order from one of the restaurants on Polk Street and have them deliver right to you at the bar.
author: Alice S.

description:
Decent wines for a decent price.  Not great.  Decent.

I have gone to the Pour House a few times, so I think this is an honest and fair review.  It is too god damn cold there.  Yes, that's right.  It is too god damn cold.  Do they think they are in San Diego?  The door is always open.  Always.  Even on nights when it is 40 degrees.  The velvet curtains around the door does very little to keep the wind out.  There is small electric heater (think of something you would find underneath an office desk) in the front near the couches.  It does nothing to keep the place warm.  The bar is half empty and is not going to warm up by body temperature.  

Here is an idea, when it gets really cold outside, why don't they act like reasonable  SF'ers and shut the door.  

The place isn't located in the greatest neighborhood.  Polk street after a certain hour, becomes sketchy with sketchy characters.  Every time I have been at The Pour House, one of these characters always wanders in and accosts me.  Fortunately, the bartenders are very aware of this problem and each and every time escort them out.  

Is it The Pour House's fault that these derelicts wander into their establishment?  No, but perhaps if they shut the door on cold nights it wouldn't be an open invitation. 

To summarize.  Shut the door on cold nights.
author: Iggy R.

description: This is a fantastic wine bar with great beer. Yes, they even have good beer here too. Friendly bartenders and the owner is great as well. Whatever the occasion is they will make sure you have a wonderful time.  If you're ever in the neighborhood , check this place out.
author: Kate D.

description: Excellent service, with out the attitude of a Mission bar. Great place to meet someone for a first date. Not too loud and seating options include relaxed seating in the back if the bar itself isn't your thing.
author: Mark N.

description: The pour house is AMAZING! They have fantastic wine and champagne. The best part though is the staff! They are so friendly and amazing. I recently took a bachelorette party there and we had a night to remember. The owner and bartenders were 110% behind us having the best night ever.
author: julie k.

description: A great little wine bar at the corner of the street for us unpriveleged folk. If you are looking for fancy-schmancy digs or sommelier-types, this is not for you. Come here to enjoy a nice glass of wine, sink into an initimate setting, great seating (used to love the couch by the window facing the street, but then they removed it to make way for a stage) and really happy bar tenders. The pours are generous, the wine is decent (not snooty Napa variety) and its easy on the wallet. I love coming here on a weekday night, you can watch the game or just have a regular conversation without screaming at the top of your voice. Great place to people watch (Polk st. characters) and parking is easily available on the street. I have never tried the bar-food here, but then again who goes to a wine bar to eat :)
author: Nisha M.

description:
Yep - very very similar to SNOB bar (what it used to be) but a little more hipster rather than nice wine bar.  

The flights are great and a deal at $12 for 4 pours. I do wish the bartender knew his wine better.... It felt weird to ask him questions and he be so un-imformed.... dude, you are working at a WINE BAR -know SOMETHING about wine...."the grape starts with a T I know that..." wow.

I got over it - its a good vibe in here. Drink wine and be happy. The wines are NOT super upscale awesome - just plain good. And that is perfectly fine with me.
author: Jessica L.

description:
This place has something for everyone. Maybe a little too much. Cowboys meet disco meets club meets sophistication meets the daily news. I left feeling so confused about what the place was about, and quite disappointed with the wine selection! Both of my glasses were "meh", and the guys next to me said the same. It didn't help that when it came time to pay, it took 15 min of trying to flag down our bartender (even though there were only 6 people in the place at the time), and me finally getting up to get his attention. I prefer the Press Club or the Hidden Vine. But if your feet can't carry you too far away from this place, I recommend Amelie.

I hate giving poor reviews :-( Hopefully I'll be able to update this review in the future.
author: Cameron G.

description: I love this wine bar. It is low key, dimly lit and a great place to grab an after work drink. It is even casual enough to go alone. They offer hefty flights and have a wide variety of wines by the glass/bottle. They don't serve a lot of food options but with wine and it being a bar its hard to have choices that don't require kitchen staff. Highly recommend stopping by.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
A friend and I came here while bar hopping through the city. A glass of wine each and beer for him after, we were nicely warmed up before heading on elsewhere. 

The bartenders were attentive and on the ball, taking our order quickly and also providing some feedback when asked questions about the wine list. There's a good selection of wine and beer, plus good quality munchies and snack foods.

While we were there early, it filled up pretty quick. It's a narrow room so it's a bit difficult to get around the crowd of people. I gave up trying to get to the bathroom when the people that were standing in front of the doorway didn't bother moving despite me trying to get through. 

The music was a bit loud at times too, and a bit difficult to hear conversation around. A wine bar would seem to imply something a bit more fancy and high end, but it's kind of a *bit* like a dive bar, albeit a bit fancier.

Not a bad place to stop for drinks.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Why I am in love with this place: anywhere from low-level to high-level wine which is perfect for penny pinchers looking to have a good time and enjoy wine and/or beer, great ambiance, and friendly staff.

My girlfriend and I love to go here to share a bottle of wine and just sit and talk. The music is great which just adds to the enjoyment of the bar and the location is in walking distance of pizza (which goes great with a night of wine), late night Thai (probably the best thing in the world), and even donuts if you are feeling frisky. 

Each time I have been here, counting three times now, the staff has been very friendly and approachable. They are very willing to talk about their favorite wines/beers and never give the impression of wanting to rush patrons to cycle new people in.

GREAT place to just hang out and enjoy some good company.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Shortly after writing my review I was contacted by the management of The Pour House.  

They informed me that the employee I encountered had been "relieved" of her duties.  Certainly it wasn't due to my experience alone.

Their prompt response and follow-through says to me this is an establishment that cares about its customers and their customer experience.   That is very impressive to me in any organization.

I'm going back to the Pour House!
author: Social B.

description:
The ambiance is nice, I dig the decor.  The music was spot on.  The bartender was awesome: very polite, engaging in conversation, quick with recommendations, and I never had an empty glass.

The Pour House bills themselves as a wine and craft beer bar.  Yet, 40% of their taps are macro brews (PBR and Blue Moon).  I understand that you need to have macros on tap to please the crowds, however, either get more taps or reduce the number of macros on tap.  One of their craft beer kegs, Sierra Nevada Torpedo, was very old.  There was no hop aroma left in that beer, very little hop flavor.  Time is not friendly to IPAs, so they should be planning a bit better and consider buying sixtels vs half barrels.  Their beer lists are also outdated.  The first two beers that I requested (Dogfish Head 90 minute and 21A Bitter American) were not available.  

I hate to give it 3 stars centered around the beer itself, but it is claiming to be a wine and craft beer bar.  It is not living up to that name at all.  I'll definitely be back, but I hope they remedy these easily solved issues.
author: Ted S.

description:
I came here Super Bowl Sunday, kind of on a whim. I walked by, and it wasn't packed and thought, hey I'll check out the second half. Glad I did. 

They had $5 pitchers (!?!) which included Blue Moon, my favorite beer of all time. I didn't need much more convincing. But I had a great time. Natalie, the bartender, was was really sweet and made sure I had everything I needed; she even introduced me to some other patrons, as I was sitting alone (sad face) and offered to order me food from the Thai place next door. I plan on making another trip to the 'hood when she is working ;)
author: Josh M.

description:
I think this place is such a gem in San Francisco.  I have been here several times now, with every time the same - FABULOUS!  The service is always on point, the music is always fantastic, but more importantly the drinks are amazing.  

The last time I went was for happy hour.  Not only were they offering this amazing Petite Syrah for only $4 a glass, they also had this fantastic cheese plate.  This place always has a fair amount of business, but I love it because every time I have been it hasn't been jammed packed.  You can actually sit down and carry on a coversation with your friends.  With that being said, it would be a great date spot too!  Needless to say, many, many glasses of wine later, I have decided this may be my favorite wine bar in SF.  

Also, which I think is awesome.  It reminds me of one of my favorite bars back home, they let you order food from the surrounding restaurants.  They even have a booklet with all the menus in there, with the numbers. You call the restaurant of your choice, and they deliver you food.  What a great idea, right?
author: Amy M.

description:
I am taking the time to write this review only because there is nothing more horrible to me then people who are rude for no reason!

Last night my friend and I went out to Powell street for the first time. Unaware of how crowed the bars would be I grabbed a slice of pizza to go and we made our way in search for a less crowded bar. 

 
We walked into The pour house at about 5 til midnight, found a spot at the bar and started to settle in. The bar tender explained we just missed their last call and they were closing in 5 mins. 

We started putting out jackets back on and I whipped out my slice of pizza to steal a couple bites before we carried on with our journey.
