The bar tender comes up to me again and asks if we had already been drinkin there, I told him no. Then he said "well can't you see this is not a restaurant, you cant eat your food here." I said "not a problem we are on out way out the door anyway." Then with a cynical tone he gestured toward the down and "well then goodbye". I was shocked, I said to him " there is no reason to be rude about it." He replied " I'm trying not to be, now leave."

There is just simply no reason to be rude to someone who has in no way wronged you. I was disappointed, bartender.
author: Angel F.

description:
For a wine bar, there isn't much of a wine selection. Maybe I've just been going to really extensive wine bars, but I was not that impressed with what they had to offer. 

A friend and I wandered in on a Saturday night after reading a couple Yelp reviews and, not going to lie, the White Town blasting sort of drew us in. It wasn't very packed and we sat at the bar. 20 minutes or so later this wave of people came in. Mixed bag of folks. I didn't care for the bartender's attitude. He wasn't the friendliest. 

Yeah, this place just didn't do it for me. Sorry guys.
author: Karena Q.

description:
We came here one Saturday with a group of 5, and the bar was just starting to get busy, however, they only had one bartender working.   We waited patiently for 15 min, then he finally came to get our order, and was extremely rude with his words and  body language.  I think he was frustrated at the fact that his colleague had not shown up yet, however, no reason to take it out on the customers.  In addition, I went to pay with my Am Ex, and he threw my card at me, and said they didn't take it.  We will never be back here!   He didnt deserve a tip, however, I didnt want to stoop to his level. Worst experience ever, especially when there are so many great bars to hit in San Fran!  I'd pick a bar closeby like Fly where the staff is nice!  

Get a new bartender!   Wine is average here too...And I'm in the industry.
author: Ashley S.

description: Great place to meet up with some good people and drink Brady Cab. Solid datemosphere!
author: Aaron H.

description: Really cool vibe. No frills and no pretention. Just a nice neighborhood spot to relax, listen to music and have a glass of wine or a beer. We tried several types of wine by the glass. Taking it down a star because we only got credit for one Groupon instead of two. Didn't realize it until we were gone. Oh well, I'll chalk it up to an honest mistake by our server..
author: Joe M.

description:
Probably, my favorite wine bar in all of San Francisco. I know this place is relatively new but I like the vibe. I like that they feature certain wines and make you expand your horizons when it comes to choosing new wines. The bartender was really nice and a great conversationalist. He was more than willing to discuss each wine and gave great recommendations.

I consider myself pretty educated when it comes to wines but even I left this place being able to learn a thing or two on wines I've never really tasted before.

I would come back here because I love being able to drink wine while watching the Giant's game.

I recommend this place!
author: Rylan C.

description: I absolutely love this place. The wine selection is extensive and the bartenders are  personable. The guy working on Sunday, Fred I think his name was, made sure my friend and I never had a dry glass and held the place down while some weirdos sauntered in throughout the night (my party was there for quite some time). We will definitely be back.
author: Jayde G.

description: Worst bartender ever for nye. I heard it was her first day, but she kept serving the same guy for half an hour and ignored the rest of the bar. Do not recommend this place for a fun day, only on a slow day.
author: Mondi L.

description:
In no way do I qualify myself as a wine connoisseur, so I will not even think to review the wine selection.

We've always walked past this small bar when it was S.N.O.B..  Thinking it was wine and only wine, we never went.  After the re-opening, one night we decided to give it a shot.  It was well worth it.  You can easily find a comfortable place to sit and have a conversation without other people breathing on you or climbing over you to order a drink.  The beer list is pretty extensive and non-happy hour prices are a bargain ($5 for a 10% ABV bottle of Maredsous is like drinking two for one!).  And it's far enough away from the ruckus of the cluster of Polk Street bars.  A one-star demerit for an early closing time (Last call is midnight, closing's around 1.), but we make sure we get our drink on well before then.

We'll be back, for sure.
author: Eric P.

description: The wine is list is extremly unimpressive. I had a hard time selecting domething interesting. The flights seem thrown together based on what yhey r trying to get rid of. The bartender was not knowledgeable at all and didn't know anything about the wine he was pouring. There are cases of wine stacked on the bookcase shelves screaming, "buy me, the owners got me at bulk discount and arnt afraid to show it". The space itself is cute and intimate so its really too bad. The olives were old or something. I will not be back
author: First L.

description:
Wine is ok. Not my kind of wine bar. Large TV's aren't my thing. 
The best aspect of this wine bar is their name.
author: Unkl- T.

description: We had the owner help us with wine selections! He was great and funny. Made our experience here at The Pour House worth it!! We will be back. Thank you Liam!!
author: Sheila S.

description:
I've been coming here, off and on, for a few years now, maybe once or twice a year, since it opened, a couple of versions of itself ago.

It's never quite hit the spot. 

Initially, it was a wine bar.  You know the drill, a long list of wines, and there are several opportunities to find what you like.  This version was my favorite, but one of the big drawbacks was that the by-the-glass price was the same if you bought a bottle, no discount for doing so, thus no incentive to buy a bottle.

Nowadays, it's a sort-of wine bar.  The menu listed two cabernet sauvignons, and a Syrah I can get elsewhere, if I have to, as it's not a favorite.  What's the point?  The space is not that impressive (and never was) and the crowd is indifferent.  It's close by, but I'd rather walk a bit farther down the street.

I'm not sure what's going on here, but the Pour House just can't seem to figure out what it is, but it's not a very good wine bar.
author: Paul T.

description: Great classy wine bar in the city. Would definitely recommend it. The owner is an absolute gentleman also.
author: Ian R.

description: Came here on a first date and it was perfect for the casual drink in a relatively intimate environment. The night I came it was raining so it deterred a lot of people from going out, so the place wasn't too crowded (Which was a huge plus for me).
author: Maggie F.

description: Great bar tender! I came here on a Sunday with some friends. It was a really chill place to get some wine and beer along with some bar snacks. They have menus for the Thai place next door and they will serve the food to you at the bar... awesome!
author: Stephen S.

description: When I think wine bar, I think a relaxed atmosphere and tasteful music. That is not what you'll get at the Pour House. For the Polk Street crowd interested in ducking in for a glass of wine, this is your spot. Loud, terrible music; loud people; mediocre wines. if you really want a great spot, it's worth the cab to SoMa for Terroir,
author: Steven W.

description: Thomas is the best bartender in town. Suggesting great wines, live music, this place is a gem. Each night they have live music (piano) and it's dog friendly.
author: Michael S.

description: This place is awesome! Great date spot. The wine good and a the bartender was very nice. I would definitely come here again.
author: R H.

description: This is a good wine bar for this section of Polk street. The wine and atmosphere are good and the service is friendly. I do not like the t.v. on all the time...but that is a trend in SF I don't understand.
author: J B.

description: When you're in a chill mood and Polk Street is packed and overrun with preppy guys and sluttastic girls, come to The Pour House. It's a cute, intimate, wine-and-beer-only place with super nice bartenders. My only complaint - it closes at midnight, so if you want to keep the night going you're forced back out into the madness.
author: Talia G.

description: Usually this is a great, low-key, and easy going wine bar. One star for the ambiance, and one star for the quality of the wine. However, this time we went there on a Thursday evening, and it seemed great to begin, as there were only 5 other people there, so we felt like we practically had the entire place to ourselves. There was a female bartender, whom was heavily flirting with two guys at the bar, just 4 bar stools away from us. Usually I am cool with such things, so we waited patiently for them, hoping she might find a way to politely excuse herself to take our order. I waited until she served them, and after waiting another 5 minutes, I politely raised my hand, and gestured with a friendly smile that we were ready, she looked me in the eye, and turned away to continue her conversation, as if we were lepers. After several more minutes, I tried to politely catch her attention in the same manner, again, not even an acknowledgement of our existence,  although she looked me directly in the eye. By now about 15 minutes have gone by, and a couple walks in, and sits at a table against the wall across from the bar, and they sit patiently waiting as well, and the bartender continues her flirtatious conversation. The couple gets up, and walks up, and has to interrupt the conversation to get the bartender's attentions, and in retrospect I probably should have done the same, but I try to take the polite, and gentle approach, especially when the bar is so slow. The bartender reacts to the couple with a whole lot of attitude, and a very rude look, but at least they seem to have managed to get the bartender to start doing her job, and they receive their wine. Silly us, we thought that she might realize at that point that there were other people, like us, still sitting there at the bar, very close to her, whom were still waiting to order, and we even tried to flag her down, as she served the couple, but no, she jumped right back to flirting with the guys. After 20 minutes, I was waiving my hands in the air, and leaning over, so I was behind the guys, and there would be no way that she could continue to ignore us, and pay attention to the guys, without being distracted by me. After she let out a hipster huff of frustration, she finally came over to us, and instead of making any effort to reconcile the obvious error on her part, the first thing she said to us, is in a snotty tone is, "there are a lot of other people I have to serve here, who ordered before you, want do you want?" Wow! So, even though the other 5 people already had their drinks, and were not asking her for anything, and the couple that came later and asked her for two glasses of wine, were a lot of people to be occupied by? I can understand when a bar is busy, as I grew up working in family hotels, and restaurants, so I have a great deal of empathy for anyone in this industry, but the fact that she blatantly ignored us, and gave us, and others, so much negative attitude, and clearly ignored her job in favor of trying to hook up with someone, is simply inexcusable. It was slow enough, that she could have very quickly taken our orders, and gone back to hitting on the guys, and we would have been cool with it. We would have been able to relax with our wine and dive into our own conversation. Instead, we received horrible service, a BS excuse with a lot of entitled negative attitude, and very small pours in retaliation for politely asking to order, and I know this, because we have been served wine there many times before.
author: J H.

description: a guy who waited our table was super friendly and nice.  the atmosphere is definitely "neighborhood" feel; nothing fancy.  if i happen to be in this neighborhood and looking for a quick stop for few beers/wine with my friends, we'd stop by.
author: Peaceful S.

description:
The right to do something does not mean that doing it is right.  ~William Safire

It is the same owner of s.n.o.b.(bad name for a wine bar
He change to the pour house (very bad name for a beer and wine bar).
Wine 3/5 beer 1/5 server 2/5 ambiance 1/5 ownership
author: Luco M.

description: This place has become the official/unofficial meeting for my Sex-and-the-City-esque group of single SF city girlfriends (I think I'm the Charlotte of the group).  We always order the flights and sometimes we customize them to our liking.  They have a great selection of wines and great atmosphere and I recently discovered you can order Thai food and have it delivered from across the street.  It comes over quickly and it's pretty yummy.  We've had cheese plates at Pour House and those are good too.  Also, it's a great escape from the post-college crowd on Polk, a godsend when you are in this neighborhood and happen to be in the 30-and-Up Club.
author: Ruba K.

description:
I used to come in for the reasonable flights and friendly service, but all that has changed. It seemslike everyone has been fired or quit due to some lame owner. The decor changes every week like the business is failing and every last ditch effort to attract new customers is being exhausted. The last chance I gave the place was this past Monday... they still offer "nuts and olives" for 1$ then charge you for both seperatly, my wine glass had slight lipstick marks, the pours have gotten smaller, my crackers and cheese were almost unedible, and I found our the charge more for a glass of wine than Costco charges for an entire bottle. I don't want to go out and pay for Costco.

Do yourself a favor and go to Amilie or Meuse instead. They are in the area and have everything this place doesn't... accept for being empty a majority of the time.
author: Rob C.

description: The BEST wine bar ever! Calm, great atmosphere. Great wines starting at just $6: glass. And the best olives in the universe for $1!!! Love this place! Everyone - come check it out!!!:)))
author: Valerie K.

description:
Such a fantastic place for a one or two drink date or to gather with groups of friends. Never seems to be too crowded so you can usually get one of the big areas in front or back if you have a bigger group.

I love Amelie, but sometimes you don't want the scene or the noise and just an escape or something laidback. Can be romantic and laidback at the sametime.
author: Mike T.

description:
1. I love wine bars.
2. I just moved into the neighborhood and The Pour House had been on my radar.
3. I wanted to fall in love with this place and have a regular, local spot.

I finally had the chance to swing by on Monday evening and was  disappointed with the service and lack of acknowledgement.  I walked into an empty establishment (with the exception of a few people sitting in the back bar) and one couple sitting near the windows.

My friend and I had planned on grabbing drinks before dinner, but I showed up a little early.  There was one guy behind the bar working, who looked up when I walked in and said nothing, yet continued chatting with the few guests who were sitting at the end of the bar.  

I sat myself at a table directly across the bar and stayed sitting for about 10-15 minutes, while waiting for my friend.  I got no "hello".  No "Can I get you anything?"  Nothing. I could totally understand if it was busy and I had to go to the bar to order a drink but the place was practically empty.  And I was sitting at a table directly across from the bar.  A simple hello would have been enough.  Honestly, I'm not a difficult person to please.  Dude behind the bar continued chatting/entertaining what seemed to be friends at the end of the bar.  

When my friend arrived, I was so turned off by being completely ignored in an empty establishment that we just walked out.  Naturally, we didn't get a goodbye either.  

Way too many options for other similar places to get whack service.  On to the next one.
author: Alysha I.

description: I remember when this bar was S.N.O.B. Same low-key place, but thankfully new name. The old name alone is what kept me from going back. Anyway, I ended up coming back because of The Pour House's weekly Local Art Thursdays. Great idea, but I don't think it happens anymore. Anyway, the place is great for meeting friends for a non-clubby hangout. We had a bit of fun on the side playing on their lopsided shuffleboard which the bar was getting rid of that week. Not an extensive on-tap selection, but plenty for the friends who were drinking beer and of course a good wine selection. There was one sole bartender, but there weren't many people to deal with, so bar service was very personal. I had some prosecco, my favorite beverage, so everything was ok with the world for me. It is well situated for taking a late night snack at neighboring restaurants in the Polk Gulch area.
author: Jen A.

description: The snacks (Cheese with nuts and crackers, and nuts and olives) were good and filling, and the pours were very generous. My wife especially liked the olives. It's quiet and laid back. There's only one thing that I disliked; the atmosphere. All of the lights were red. Even the lights over the bar were upside down tin water tubs (like you would find on a farm) with red lights screwed into them. Behind the bar was their 'office' and 6 pack beer storage. When relaxing with a nice glass of Old Vine Zin, I really would rather not have to look at a computer and beer storage. A simple curtain would correct this. They did have couch sitting areas on either end of the bar, which was nice.
author: Clint C.

description:
I just discovered my new favorite wine bar in the city. It's so refreshing to find a place on Polk where you can listen to great music while still hearing yourself talk, all while enjoying great wines for a reasonable price. 

They are very generous with their pours and let you try anything before ordering a glass. The owner, Liam, was funny, engaging and so appreciative of his clients and the bartenders were attentive and very friendly. There was no pretentiousness like you find at so many other wine bars and we felt like we were really taken care of there.

They do close around midnight, so it's not a great late night place, but it's the perfect spot for a mellow evening with friends or a date. This is definitely a gem in Russian Hill and I will be coming back often.
author: Cher E.

description: This is my go-to bar on Polk. Pretty much every other bar is packed to fire-hazard levels, and getting the bartender's attention is purely impossible. If my boyfriend and I aren't feeling like going across the city, we'll walk over to the Pour House. What I mostly love about this place is that it's not crazy crowded and the bartenders are pretty great. They both know our usual and have great taste in music. The wine selection is pretty extensive, and they have a cheese plate that's great for snacking. While they don't have anything else to eat, you can order from the Thai restaurant Chai-Yo and they'll bring it right to where you're sitting in the bar. It's fantastic! We've definitely spent many a Friday night watching the Giant's game and drinking champagne.
author: Laurelle H.

description: Awesome place.. Awesome vibe.  The Pour House is a cool please to chill with friends.  It has an intimate vibe and feel.  A glass of Chimay is only $6, which is pretty good.
author: Shad B.

description: This is a nice place with a low-key atmosphere that has a great list of wine and beer.  The prices are good and the service is friendly and helpful.  Try it out!
author: Tapedeck B.

description: I had my bachelorette party here, and it was one of the best experiences of my life.  The owner, Liam, is the nicest and friendliest guy, great wine/champagne selection and overall perfect night!  Would definitely recommend!
author: Alexandra B.

description: 10-15-11....Hmmm, no men here (except for my hubbie and the bartender). Great wines and good beer. I had the malbec and he had the Dogfish Head - both great choices.
author: Dawn C.

description: Love this place. They have beer as well as an assortment of wines. They also offer flights and sometimes have groupon deals. Cheaper than other wine bars in the city.
author: M S.

description: This bar is perfect for an intimate gathering. I come here quite a bit for some one on one conversation, and it's always a fun time. The bartenders are usually pretty friendly and talkative, and helpful when it comes to choosing a wine to drink. I've never seen this place completely packed, which is nice, as I don't think I'd enjoy it quite as much if it was loud and you could hardly move through the bar. They offer small plates of food (such as cheese and crackers) which may be helpful to know.
author: Ashley D.

description: It's a mellow and approachable spot with generous pours.  Couches are comfy. I'd go back. We would have stayed longer, but they were out of cheese!
author: Sarah T.

description: Small selection of wines over-priced for the vintage, understaffed (only 1 poor fella for the whole place), 3 cheeses listed on the menu and they were out of 1, hummus tasted pre-packaged not home made. The atmosphere was nice so it's too bad the quality was disappointing.
author: Roberta B.

description: I am not that cool when it comes to wine but I know enough to know that this place is a gem!!  We headed over here after dinner for a glass of wine and I love the atmosphere - it's so cozy and relaxing.  The bartender was amazing - recommending great wines and giving us tastes to make sure we got exactly what we were looking for.  Even on a Monday night, the people there were cool and it was a great place to be.  To top the night off, the bartender gave our friend her wine for free because it was her birthday - great guy!!!  We will be back.
author: Arica V.

description: The pour house has some great wines; it's casual and a great place for a group get together. I had a couple glasses of the pinot noir, it was delicious. The bartender was very nice and easy going. I think this is a great and low key place to go for some great wine if you're not quite in the mood to sit at a table and deal with snooty waiters.
author: Natalie M.

description: Got a great beer (Dogfish Head) and a great wine (Santa Barbara Crossing) with great service.  I just love the dark vibe of this place.  I'll be back soon.
author: Corey V.

description: One of the worst places in SF if you are looking to go to a place where you will fall to sleep while getting an awful service, please go to Pour House.
author: Raul G.

description: I had my birthday party here a few days ago and this really turned out to be the perfect spot. We mostly worked with Liam (owner) and Chance (bartender), and both were gracious, friendly, and accommodating. Chance is very knowledgeable about wines - we loved all of his recommendations and friendly service!
author: Clara S.

description: Bartenders are nice & attentive. They serve u water first - very classy move! And dogfish head/90 min on tap! More wine than beer but good hangout place for both!
author: Bessie T.

description: This is a great neighborhood wine bar.  It isn't pretentious and over-run by a bunch of wannabe wine snobs.  They have a nice selection, the bartenders are great and if you get hungry you can order Thai food from next door!  Go here if you want low key, ambiance, yummy wine and Thai food! :-)
author: Mao K.

description: This bar is very classy AND has the atmosphere of a friendly neighborhood joint.  I really like the selection of beer, not to mention the prices are very affordable!  I definitely recommend this place if you want to go out and have fun with your friends or significant other !
author: Madison M.

description: Awesome place! Great, friendly service. Kinda quiet on that Sunday. Nice, dark, intimate. Great date place. Good wine selection.
author: Fabian F.

description: I was in San Fran for the weekend, and found this place through Groupon.  We were staying about 10 blocks away, so I figured it was a good deal... I was pleasantly surprised to find out how cool it was!  Dimly lit, good music playing, and the best bartender ever!  He was nice, informative and very generous with the pours!  I wish I had a place like this in Seattle!  I highly recommend this place, and you can also have food delivered right to the bar!  We had Thai that was delicious and fast!
author: Tami M.

description: The Pour House is a Polk Street gem. This place has combined a pretty darn good wine menu with a good beer selection mixed with a cool ambiance. I was there this weekend with a large group of people in the back of the bar. Everyone really enjoyed themselves, and remarked on how chill and economical this place was. What a good find!  Would have given the Pour House 5 stars had it not been playing loud club music. This is decidedly NOT a club, but a totally enjoyable wine and beer bar.  Pour House: Own it!  Don't play club or trance music hoping a spontaneous dance party will erupt! (Maybe one will, but I've never seen it!).
author: Hil W.

description: Atmosphere is romantic, on a very busy section of Polk. The waitress was very nice. We had some beer, don't remember the name. Next time will try wine.
author: Emmy P.

description: Perfect lil' wine spot! My sister & I yelped this place before our trip to SF. It was close to our hotel, the bartendar was very nice, helpful & knowledgeable about the wines. We purchased one flight of red & a flight of white for a whopping $24!!! And I must tell you the pours were GENEROUS!! My only tiny gripe is that there were no cheese plates available, we got there around 10:30pm.. He was only able to offer us some bar nuts, but sister is allergic, so that was a bust!  We closed the place down at midnight, then headed over Tommy's Joynt for some late-late nite grub... I will definitely be back, would love to bring my hubby...
author: Karrie K.

description: Used to be called S.N.O.B.  Really liked the bartenders who were friendly and joked around with my friend and I,and the dark lighting and simple decor.
author: Muriel D.

description:
Love it, love it, love it. I initially went there because I bought a groupon online but I've been back a few times afterwards too. I like the rustic look of the place, I love the bartenders/wine servers and I love the selection of wine and beer.  
The futon is the best place to sit. It's cozy and it's right by the window so you can people watch.  
The best part about the place is that they let you order food from a nearby Thai restaurant. They deliver :)
This place is definitely one of my favs.
author: Swati K.

description: comfortable wine bar.  Great atmosphere and a fair wine selection.  They give you generous pours, especially on their flights.  Very friendly staff.  Would come back here again.
author: Francis L.

description: I came here on a Wednesday night around  8:30 pm and it was pretty full. The ambiance is very cozy, unpretentious, and the bar tender was really friendly. The flight of red wine was a steal at $12 and they were very generous with their servings. I had to have my friend drink some of mine! Overall it's a really great place to hang out and talk, casual but still nice, good music, and overall a great time. The service was wonderful and it showed that he really cared about the customers.
author: Misty M.

description:
Went in for a first date- and Pour Bar turned out to be the perfect place. The music wasn't too loud (like so many bars in the city) and we were able to enjoy a nice conversation. The beer and wine selection was good- maybe not as good as other wine and beer bars in  the city (not enough beer on tap) but it was decent.

What I really took note of was how friendly and personable the bartender was. It is so nice to get such great service with a smile.
author: Jessica B.

description: Great spot is you like beer and iwne, which I do! Excellent service, great ambiance and you can get food from the surrounding area and bring it in.  Great selection of wine, although I had the sparkling wine which was great and then I switched to an awesome beer...trying to recall what is was (similar to a Hefeweizen). Again great service, no overally crowded!  I will come back and bring my pals!
author: Ashley L.

description: I love this place. Unpretentious wine bar with great music, couches and the bar tenders are super helpful, nice...I'll definitely come back here.
author: Zarpana K.

description: Great, quiet night at the cozy Pour House. Had the Spanish wine special ($7) and generous pour by Matt the 'tender. Tip: if your appetite needs more than cheese/dips you can call-in Thai food from  next door. We dialed Chaya-yo from the landline (they know the digits) and they brought all the linens/cutlery/food straight from the kitchen. Delicious wine, spicy Thai, and a cute bartender to boot. We'll def be back!
author: Darya P.

description: Great place to come alone or with friends. Try the red flight for $12. They pour you 4 healthy tastes. Simple selection and a great Malbec. Groupon brought me in but Rafael keeps me coming back. Great service.
author: Heather W.

description: AWESOME atmosphere, wine was great, had a wonderful time just sitting enjoying my vino and relaxing.
author: Christy H.

description: Went here yesterday afternoon and ordered a bottle of bubbles for 3 of us. They didn't have the sparkling rose so we ordered the French brut. The bartender then found some rose that was open and gave us a free glass. My husband was also happy as they had a great selection of beer and huge beer glasses. I also left a bag of british food (marmite, teabags, etc from the british shop down the road) there and the bartender was very friendly when I called and has put it aside for me to collect.
author: Molly W.

description: Place is way more chill than anywhere else on Polk.  Syrah was tasty.  Accidentally left my laptop there and they took care of it overnight.  Pretty awesome right?  Highly recommend...
author: chefboyardee b.

description: We had a friends birthday party here and everything was perfect. The location was easy for people coming from East Bay and there was parking across the street. The staff made it easy to plan the event and were very helpful during event. We had about 50 people at the party and didn't feel crowed even with another party in front. We brought in our own food and the alcohol worked out great. Everyone had a great time. I would do another event at The Pour house! Thanks again.
author: C T.

description: I've been going to The Pour House for over a year and have really wanted to like it and brought friends here many times. However, though the atmosphere and value is great, the service is pretty lacking to the point of being rude sometimes. I don't know if I'd come back after another bad experience tonight.
author: Drew L.

description: Classy and cool.  Wine and beer list has been revamped and now much improved.  Service is excellent.  Back area can be reserved for private parties.  I recently hosted a bday party for my girlfriend in the back area.  Everyone had a blast.
author: David C.

description: This place is great now that it is redone! They had a lot of great options and the ambiance was cool and comfortable. The music was a little loud for my taste because I could barely hear what my date was saying, but at least it was cool music! I liked the lounge couches in the front where you could lay and cuddle! I'll definitely cone back here.
author: Marian G.

description: This just became my new favorite wine bar!  Their selections of wines are incredible and it is fabulous that they are willing to let you try a wine before you order it.  Ryan, the bartender, was the only one working last night but I never felt neglected.  He was always right there when my glass was empty to offer me another glass.  This is a great place to go with friends and especially friends who are not necessarily wine people but prefer beer as they have a bunch of beers on tap and in a bottle.  The other great thing is you can bring food into the bar from local restaurants, I highly recommend the shawarma from Frisco's Pizza and Shawarma.   Pour house does have some cheese plates available to order but I got the kalamata olives, which were absolutely delicious!  Ended up spending over 4 hours there and never felt rushed.  Total bill with four people, more than a dozen glasses of wine and more than 10 beers came to $91, pretty dang impressive!  Will most certainly be returning!
author: Adrienne B.
